xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9 http://www.loc.gov/ead/ead.xsd">arms_1991_019_catherine_street_ferryGuide to the Records relating to the Catherine Street Ferry 1991.019Collection processed by Matthew GorhamThis collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.Brooklyn Historical SocietyCenter for Brooklyn History128 Pierrepont StreetBrooklyn 11201cbhreference@bklynlibrary.orgThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2023-04-03T18:41:03engDescribing Archives: A Content StandardApril 5, 2019

Brooklyn Historical Society
Records relating to the Catherine Street Ferry
Apfelbaum, Charles
Catherine and Main Street Ferry Company (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
1991.019
0.1 Linear Feet in one manuscript box folder and one oversized box folder (OS-38).
1801 The collection contains six proposals and one letter of recommendation which were submitted to the Common Council of Brooklyn in 1801 for the operation of the Catherine Street Ferry for three years beginning on May 1, 1801. A0110 OS-38 5
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Charles Apfelbaum, 1991.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Records relating to the Catherine Street Ferry, 1991.019, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
